properties.headline: Snow Squall Warning issued January 14 at 5:34PM MST until January 14 at 5:45PM MST by NWS Cheyenne WY
properties.description:
At 534 PM MST, a dangerous snow squall was located near Hanna, or 39
miles east of Rawlins, moving northeast at 40 mph.

HAZARD...Extremely poor visibility heavy snow and blowing snow. Wind
gusts up to 30 mph.

SOURCE...Radar and webcams.

IMPACT...Dangerous life-threatening travel.

This includes Interstate 80 in Wyoming between mile markers 228 and
259.

Locations impacted include...
Hanna, Medicine Bow and Elk Mountain.
properties.instruction:
Serious injuries and deaths may result from people exiting their
vehicles during a snow squall. Drivers may not be able to see you or
to stop! If stopped on the roadway or involved in an accident,
quickly exit your vehicle move as far away from the roadway as
possible ONLY when it is safe to do so. Do not stand along or near
the roadway, since approaching vehicles may be unable to maintain
control.

Slow Down! Rapid changes in visibility and road conditions are
expected with this dangerous snow squall. Be alert for sudden
whiteout conditions.

NWSheadline: A SNOW SQUALL WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 545 PM MST FOR EAST CENTRAL CARBON COUNTY
